data.message: Woohoo

message:
We're featured in Bloomberg Business! 

Alec Radford and Luke Metz's research collaboration with Soumith Chintala (Facebook) has "created a stir in the research community. Ian Goodfellow, a Google senior research scientist, said he looks forward to discussing it with other researchers at conferences next year and was pleasantly surprised to see it come out of a startup."

http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-12-02/computers-learn-how-to-paint-whatever-you-tell-them-to

Alec Radford (our Head of Research), Luke Metz, and Soumith Chintala have released a new research paper, "Unsupervised Representation Learning with Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks". 

Check out their work, including original bedrooms and faces created by neural nets:
http://ow.ly/V1avT

Tip #5: Use your words.

"Sit down and tell them how much you appreciate their work. Nothing goes further than authenticity. Don't wrap your feelings up in trophies or money. Just have a human-to-human conversation." - Slater

Happy #Thanksgiving from the indicrew!

(And thank you, SUCCESS Magazine & YEC!)

Here's something to try out in between mouthfuls of turkey and stuffing! 

https://indico.io/blog/email-sentiment/

Don't forget to get your free tickets for our talk at General Assembly Boston tomorrow night at 6:30pm EST. 

Slater Victoroff, our CEO, will help you...

- Understand how to vet a machine learning provider for legitimacy
- Understand the difference between major areas of machine learning
- Understand how to structure a problem to make it ready for a machine learning specialist
- Understand why accuracy is a poor metric for most machine learning problems

See you there!

https://generalassemb.ly/education/machine-learning-for-non-technical-people/boston/18743

message: We've received 10 billion API calls \u2014 and counting. Thank you for supporting our mission to make machine learning more widespread, seamless, and easy to use! \ud83c\udf89

message: Wow. We turned 2 today! It's been an amazing journey so far, and it keeps getting better. A huge thanks to all of you who have helped and supported us as we grow!

"Machine learning enables automated, more efficient predictive analytics. Instead of hiring 100 people to analyze 1,000 data points each, a single machine can do it all in a fraction of the time. message: Idea I had the other day: Is it possible to use sentiment analysis of text to match voice inflections of emotion (or vice versa)? It's very binary at the moment, and it would be pretty cool to make robot-read text more animate.

Happy #WomensEqualityDay! 95 years ago, women gained the right to vote. At indico, we believe all genders should be treated equally, whether it\u2019s in terms of politics, the workplace, or basic human rights. #EqualityForALL

Read on for more information on this historical day: http://time.com/4010645/womens-equality-day/

Our latest blog post is out: VISUALIZING WITH T-SNE

Let's go beyond just classifying images of cats or dogs. Learn to identify subsets of these animals using cluster analysis with t-Distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE) and indico's Image Features API.

data.message: Hi Trevor, our Sentiment_HQ model handles sarcasm, but is only available for Private Cloud users right now. We'll be updating our website to reflect this.
have you published a paper enumerating how you detect sarcasm using natural language processing?

We have not. Given the large amount of overhead required to do so, we typically avoid publishing papers, but the basis of Sentiment_HQ is a recurrent neural net trained on a very large corpus. We put up a youtube video of our general approach to RNNs here though:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VINCQghQRuM

I hope that helps, let us know if you have any other questions. Currently sentiment_hq is only available to private cloud customers, but we plan on releasing it to the public api in July.

message: your sentiment analysis engine doesn't handle sarcasm at all.

message:
\u201cYou\u2019ve all heard the buzzwords\u2026and they\u2019re real. Machine learning is a technology that can power the next industrial revolution. What the steam engine did for mechanical labor, machine learning is capable of doing for intellectual labor \u2014 and indico is making it easier."

https://indico.io/blog/indico-wins-boston-techjam-2015/

"Soothing cultural anxiety is crucial to a foreseeable future with AI and machine learning; however, two of the biggest factors preventing this are fear and miseducation. People simply don\u2019t know enough about how artificial intelligence and machine learning can benefit us; and from what they do know, the future looks like an epic battle scene between Skynet and Terminator. Now is the time to separate fact from fiction and explore the ways machine and human intelligence can and are working for us."

 http://ow.ly/Oln0f

Thank you everyone at Boston TechJam yesterday for voting for indico as your favorite #startup! We're thrilled that you support our mission of making machine learning more widespread and easy to use :)

"Because the industry is so young, many people looking to make use of machine learning often rely on crowd wisdom, third party guidance, or even personal relationships with firms when choosing a service provider.

Don\u2019t worry! There are a few simple ways to evaluate the pre-trained models provided by these services and then identify the ones that will bring value to your company."

Here are 6 best practices for choosing the right #MachineLearning service for your business: http://ow.ly/O2RDO

"Data scientists often come from diverse backgrounds and frequently don't have much, if any, in the way of formal training in computer science or software development. That being said, most data scientists at some point will find themselves in discussions with software engineers because of some code that already is or will be touching production code.

This conversation will probably go something like this:

SE: 'You didn't check your code and your tests into master without a code review, did you?'

DS: 'Checked my what into what without a what?' " 

http://ow.ly/NVwJg #datascience

data.message: Yay for Indico! I first clicked on the link on my Android phone and the website graphics were out of whack. It could just be my connection is slow and it looks great on my iPad. Just thought you'd like to know.
It is beautiful. You guys are the motivation to get my startup alive and kicking. I'll be catching up soon. :P

message:
The new site is pushed! check it out at http://indico.io.

Worth noting that at present, the site is a follow-through on the commitment to everyone that helped us out so much last night and full functionality will be added to the site through the rest of this week, along with some new features and a brand new blog series!

Again, thanks so much to everyone that helped us out last night.
Amazing Response! Thanks so much for everyone that's been helping us out on this bet! We've quadrupled our likes in less than two hours!

We finally launched our blog! There's plenty more to come.
http://indicods.tumblr.com/
Officially decided to push the button and publish the secret facebook for Indico Data Solutions.
